identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study to Test the Effectiveness and Safety of MK0893 in Combination With Other Drugs Used to Treat Type 2 Diabetes (0893-015)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase IIa, Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Active Comparator-Controlled Clinical Trial to Study the Efficacy and Safety of MK0893 in Combination With Sitagliptin or in Combination With Metformin in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Who Have Inadequate Glycemic Control

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study will test the effectiveness and safety of treatment with MK-0893 in combination with other drugs commonly used to treat type 2 diabetes for a duration up to 13 weeks.

interventions.name: MK-0893
interventions.description: Initial loading dose of 200 mg MK-0893 at randomization, followed by MK-0893 administered orally as 40 mg tablets daily throughout the double-blind treatment period (4 weeks).

interventions.name: Sitagliptin
interventions.description: Sitagliptin Phosphate administered orally as 100 mg tablets daily before the morning meal throughout the double-blind treatment period (4 weeks).

interventions.name: Metformin
interventions.description: Metformin taken orally (500 mg tablets) over an initial 2-week titration period starting at 500 mg administered twice daily before the morning and evening meals, increasing to 1500 mg daily, and ending with 1000 mg twice daily. Metformin then administered throughout the double-blind treatment period (4 weeks).

interventions.name: Placebo for MK-0893
interventions.description: Matching placebo for MK-0893 was orally administered for the loading dose (200 mg) and for the following daily treatment (40 mg) over the 4 week double blind treatment period.

interventions.name: Placebo for Sitagliptin
interventions.description: Matching placebo for Sitagliptin (100 mg) administered orally as 100 mg tablets daily before the morning meal throughout the double-blind treatment period (4 weeks).

interventions.name: Placebo for Metformin
interventions.description: Metformin-matched placebo taken orally (500 mg tablets) over an initial 2-week titration period starting at 500 mg administered twice daily before the morning and evening meals, increasing to 1500 mg daily, and ending with 1000 mg twice daily. Metformin-matched placebo then administered throughout the double-blind treatment period (4 weeks).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline (BL) to Week 4 in 24-hour Weighted Mean Glucose (WMG) Levels
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: BL, 4 weeks (end of double-blind treatment period)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From BL to Week 4 in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: BL, 4 weeks (end of double-blind treatment period)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From BL to Week 4 in 2-hr Glucose Area Under The Curve (AUC)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: BL, 4 weeks (end of double-blind treatment period)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From BL to Week 4 in the 2-Hour Total GLP-1 Total AUC
secondaryOutcomes.description: Glucagon-Like Peptide-1 (GLP-1) is an incretin hormone that acts as a potent insulin secretegogue in response to nutrient ingestion and stimulates glucose disposition. The total AUC of Total GLP-1 levels was calculated from blood sample data measured after the morning meal.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: BL, 4 weeks (end of double-blind treatment period)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From BL to Week 4 in the 2-Hour Active GLP-1 Total AUC
secondaryOutcomes.description: GLP-1 is cleaved from proglucagon to form the active peptide GLP-1. The active form promotes suppression of glucagon secretion. The total AUC of Active GLP-1 levels was calculated from blood sample data measured after the morning meal.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: BL, 4 weeks (end of double-blind treatment period)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Participants who have Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus, with suboptimal glucose control, while either not on AHA (antihyperglycemic agent) therapy or on monotherapy or on low-dose combination therapy

Exclusion Criteria:

* Participants have a history of Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus
* Participants taking insulin or thiazolidinediones (TZDs: peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor \[PPAR\]-gamma agonists)
* Participants who have a contraindication to metformin or sitagliptin

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Participants received matching placebos to MK-0893, Sitagliptin, and Metformin during a 2-week run-in period.

groups.title: MK-0893 + Sitagliptin
groups.description: Participants received an initial loading dose of 200 mg MK-0893 at randomization, followed by MK-0893 administered orally as 40 mg tablets daily throughout the double-blind treatment period. Sitagliptin was administered orally as 100 mg tablets daily before the morning meal throughout the double-blind treatment period.

groups.title: MK-0893 + Metformin
groups.description: Participants received an initial loading dose of 200 mg MK-0893 at randomization, followed by MK-0893 orally (40 mg tablets) administered daily throughout the double-blind treatment period. Participants received Metformin orally (500 mg tablets) over an initial 2-week titration period starting at 500 mg administered twice daily before the morning and evening meals, increasing to 1500 mg daily, and ending with 1000 mg twice daily. Metformin was then administered throughout the double-blind treatment period.

groups.title: Sitagliptin + Metformin
groups.description: Sitagliptin was administered orally as 100 mg tablets daily before the morning meal throughout the double-blind treatment period. Participants received Metformin orally (500 mg tablets) over an initial 2-week titration period starting at 500 mg administered twice daily before the morning and evening meals, increasing to 1500 mg daily, and ending with 1000 mg twice daily. Metformin was then administered throughout the double-blind treatment period.

groups.title: Total
groups.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline (BL) to Week 4 in 24-hour Weighted Mean Glucose (WMG) Levels
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: BL, 4 weeks (end of double-blind treatment period)

groups.title: MK-0893 + Sitagliptin
groups.description: Participants received an initial loading dose of 200 mg MK-0893 at randomization, followed by MK-0893 administered orally as 40 mg tablets daily throughout the double-blind treatment period. Sitagliptin was administered orally as 100 mg tablets daily before the morning meal throughout the double-blind treatment period.

groups.title: MK-0893 + Metformin
groups.description: Participants received an initial loading dose of 200 mg MK-0893 at randomization, followed by MK-0893 orally (40 mg tablets) administered daily throughout the double-blind treatment period. Participants received Metformin orally (500 mg tablets) over an initial 2-week titration period starting at 500 mg administered twice daily before the morning and evening meals, increasing to 1500 mg daily, and ending with 1000 mg twice daily. Metformin was then administered throughout the double-blind treatment period.

groups.title: Sitagliptin + Metformin
groups.description: Sitagliptin was administered orally as 100 mg tablets daily before the morning meal throughout the double-blind treatment period. Participants received Metformin orally (500 mg tablets) over an initial 2-week titration period starting at 500 mg administered twice daily before the morning and evening meals, increasing to 1500 mg daily, and ending with 1000 mg twice daily. Metformin was then administered throughout the double-blind treatment period.

analyses.groupDescription: Hypothesis: After 4 weeks of treatment, MK-0893+sitagliptin provide greater reduction in 24-hour WMG than sitagliptin+metformin. Using a standard deviation (SD) of 23.5 mg/dL, a sample size of 40 participants per group had 80% power to detect a true difference of 15 mg/dL in the mean change from BL in 24-hour WMG between any 2 treatment groups for a two-sided test at alpha=0.05, with a half-width of 10.3 mg/dL around the 95% confidence interval (CI) for the between group difference.

Hypothesis: After 4 weeks of treatment, MK-0893+metformin provide greater reduction in 24-hour WMG than sitagliptin+metformin. Using a standard deviation (SD) of 23.5 mg/dL, a sample size of 40 participants per group had 80% power to detect a true difference of 15 mg/dL in the mean change from BL in 24-hour WMG between any 2 treatment groups for a two-sided test at alpha=0.05, with a half-width of 10.3 mg/dL around the 95% confidence interval for the between group difference.

Using a standard deviation (SD) of 23.5 mg/dL, a sample size of 40 participants per group had 80% power to detect a true difference of 15 mg/dL in the mean change from BL in 24-hour FPG between any 2 treatment groups for a two-sided test at alpha=0.05, with a half-width of 10.3 mg/dL around the 95% confidence interval for the between group difference.

Hypothesis: After 4 weeks of treatment, MK-0893+metformin provide greater reduction in 24-hour FPG than sitagliptin+metformin. Using a standard deviation (SD) of 23.5 mg/dL, a sample size of 40 participants per group had 80% power to detect a true difference of 15 mg/dL in the mean change from BL in 24-hour FPG between any 2 treatment groups for a two-sided test at alpha=0.05, with a half-width of 10.3 mg/dL around the 95% confidence interval for the between group difference.

Hypothesis: After 4 weeks of treatment, MK-0893+metformin provide greater reduction in 2-hr Glucose AUC than sitagliptin+metformin. Using a SD of 23.5 mg/dL, a sample size of 40 participants per group had 80% power to detect a true difference of 15 mg/dL in the mean change from BL in 2-Hour Glucose Total AUC between any 2 treatment groups for a two-sided test at alpha=0.05, with a half-width of 10.3 mg/dL around the 95% confidence interval for the between group difference.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: The SPONSOR must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the SPONSOR as confidential must be deleted prior to submission. SPONSOR review can be expedited to meet publication guidelines.

pointOfContact.title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
